On Tue, Jul 29, 2025 at 9: 56 AM Jeong Kim <jeongykim25@ gmail. com> wrote: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: <credentialing@ verity. cloud> Date: Mon, Jun 30, 2025 at 12: 46 PM Subject: PDS Health Dentist in Training Pre-Credentialing

On Tue, Jul 29, 2025 at 9:56 AM Jeong Kim <jeongykim25@gmail.com> wrote:


---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: <credentialing@verity.cloud>
Date: Mon, Jun 30, 2025 at 12:46 PM
Subject: PDS Health Dentist in Training Pre-Credentialing Application Instructions
To: <jeongykim25@gmail.com>, <brownn@pacden.com>, <RedwineH@pacden.com>, <tory.helvey@pdshealth.com>


Welcome to PDS Health Start Your Credentialing Process Today!
 
Dear Dr. Jeong Kim,
To ensure we're ready for your first day of patient care, it's important to begin the insurance credentialing process as early as possible. While some key documents will only become available after graduation, you can start submitting many of the required items now.
Please review these documents thoroughly, as doing so will help expedite the credentialing process. Be sure to keep a copy of this letter for reference, so you'll know exactly what steps to take once your dental license is issued.
Attached are a few documents to help guide you through this initial process.
 
You can provide the below documents by uploading them to your Hub account now:
 
1. CV/Resume Format
- Must include both education and work history  
- Include your anticipated graduation date
- List PDS Health on your resume using the following format: MM/YYYY (start date) Present
- All dates must be formatted as MM/YYYY - MM/YYYY
- Carriers will not accept a resume with an education and/or work history gap of more than 30 days.
- If there is a gap in your education and/or work history, it must be clearly explained on the CV with corresponding MM/YYYY - MM/YYYY dates
2. Driver's License, U.S. Passport/State ID - Must be valid and not expired
3. Current CPR Card - Can't expire within 45 days of receiving your state dental license
4. ADA account setup (CAQH) - See attached instructions
 
What You'll Submit After You Receive Your State Dental License:
 
1. State Dental License
- Once issued, upload a copy to CredentialStream HUB account
- Notify your Regional/Operations Manager once you've received your state dental license and remind them to update your job description in TMP.
- This triggers processes that must take place before you see patients in the office, including an additional background check process.
2. DEA/Controlled Substance License (if you are going to be prescribing medication considered a controlled substance, you will need your federal DEA)
3. NPI Number
- Link to NPPES website: https://nppes.cms.hhs.gov/
- Please ensure your state dental license is added to the Taxonomy section of your NPPES account.
- Verify you have selected the correct taxonomy code that matches your specialty.
- You'll need the username and password created when your Type 1 NPI was obtained
4. DDS/DMD Diploma
Please note: Once your license is uploaded, complete uploading all your credentialing documents to your application through your CredentialStream Hub account and submit.
 
Accessing your CredentialStream Hub Account:
 
1. Access CredentialStream here: https://hub.veritystream.cloud/app/38516/userlogin
2. Click Don't Have a login? Use First Time Login using this temporary login: jeongykim25@gmail.com
3. An email will immediately be sent with a secure link to create your password for your Provider Hub.
4. Upon gaining access to your Provider Hub, click Let's Get Started and follow prompts which will guide you through the process.  
5. Reference the attached Required Insurance Credentialing Documents for a list of requirements by licensure and state.
6. Complete all tabs under the Profile section. Click Save & Continue to automatically jump to the next section.
7. Upon completion, click Review Information to verify there are no issues. Once reviewed, click Continue to Submit and our PDS Credentialing Team will be notified.
8. If you have any questions as you begin this process, the Credentialing Team is here to support you in every step of the way.
 
Warm regards,
The PDS Health Credentialing Team - pds_credentialstream@pdshealth.com

Welcome to PDS Health Start Your Credentialing Process Today!

Dear Dr. Jeong Kim,
To ensure we're ready for your first day of patient care, it's important to begin the insurance credentialing process as early as possible. While some key documents will only become available after graduation, you can start submitting many of the required items now.
Please review these documents thoroughly, as doing so will help expedite the credentialing process. Be sure to keep a copy of this letter for reference, so you'll know exactly what steps to take once your dental license is issued.
Attached are a few documents to help guide you through this initial process.

You can provide the below documents by uploading them to your Hub account now:

- If there is a gap in your education and/or work history, it must be clearly explained on the CV with corresponding MM/YYYY - MM/YYYY dates
2. Driver's License, U.S. Passport/State ID - Must be valid and not expired
3. Current CPR Card - Can't expire within 45 days of receiving your state dental license

What You'll Submit After You Receive Your State Dental License:

1. State Dental License
- Once issued, upload a copy to CredentialStream HUB account
- Notify your Regional/Operations Manager once you've received your state dental license and remind them to update your job description in TMP.
- This triggers processes that must take place before you see patients in the office, including an additional background check process.
2. DEA/Controlled Substance License (if you are going to be prescribing medication considered a controlled substance, you will need your federal DEA)
3. NPI Number
- Link to NPPES website: https://nppes.cms.hhs.gov/<https://urldefense.com/v3/__https://nppes.cms.hhs.gov/__;!!Jj8M_0EPIPXN6A!Em2aaNzFmqiQuwNtlmCRWDRpHVGYpZ_12tv1PtoJVxuyRg_1VTAJpO9uhlHLh5DVhQunLIrvOLcU0EwsAq6s$>
- Please ensure your state dental license is added to the Taxonomy section of your NPPES account.
- Verify you have selected the correct taxonomy code that matches your specialty.
- You'll need the username and password created when your Type 1 NPI was obtained
4. DDS/DMD Diploma
Please note: Once your license is uploaded, complete uploading all your credentialing documents to your application through your CredentialStream Hub account and submit.

Accessing your CredentialStream Hub Account:

1. Access CredentialStream here: https://hub.veritystream.cloud/app/38516/userlogin<https://urldefense.com/v3/__https://hub.veritystream.cloud/app/38516/userlogin__;!!Jj8M_0EPIPXN6A!Em2aaNzFmqiQuwNtlmCRWDRpHVGYpZ_12tv1PtoJVxuyRg_1VTAJpO9uhlHLh5DVhQunLIrvOLcU0EHE7sKg$>
2. Click Don't Have a login? Use First Time Login using this temporary login: jeongykim25@gmail.com<mailto:jeongykim25@gmail.com>
3. An email will immediately be sent with a secure link to create your password for your Provider Hub.
4. Upon gaining access to your Provider Hub, click Let's Get Started and follow prompts which will guide you through the process.
5. Reference the attached Required Insurance Credentialing Documents for a list of requirements by licensure and state.
6. Complete all tabs under the Profile section. Click Save & Continue to automatically jump to the next section.
7. Upon completion, click Review Information to verify there are no issues. Once reviewed, click Continue to Submit and our PDS Credentialing Team will be notified.
8. If you have any questions as you begin this process, the Credentialing Team is here to support you in every step of the way.
